10.x on euronunet VM

MEMPHYS_vis

NOTE : even if working on a virtual machine, it is advised to run this display straight on your local device. This program uses intensively OpenGL to render the scenes but also for the user interface. You are going to have a better reactivity of the interactivity by exploiting straight your local graphics resources.

The MEMPHYS_vis program is installed under : 

     /usr/local/MEMPHYS_vis

To run, from a terminal, just do : 

     Linux> /usr/local/MEMPHYS_vis/10.1.0/bin/MEMPHYS

or double click on this program from the file explorer.

To see how it works, the best is to watch the MEMPHYS_vis.mov video demo file found on the download area or on iridium at : 

    /nfs/users/gbarrand/public/MEMPHYS_vis.mov

It should be available also on YouTube with "MEMPHYS vis on euronunet VM" (or through "Guy Barrand" channel).

MEMPHYS simulation

The MEMPHYS simulation (without visualisation) program is installed under : 

     /usr/local/MEMPHYS

To run, from a terminal, just do : 

     Linux> /usr/local/MEMPHYS/10.1.0
        sh> . ./run_g410x_setup.sh         # to use Geant4 data found under /usr/local/geant4/data_103.
     Linux> cd exa_run
     Linux> ../bin/MEMPHYS_sim             # it should produce a MEMPHYS.root.
     Linux> ../bin/MEMPHYS_read_plot       # plot with text font done with the vector Hershey font (the one of CERN-HBOOK).
     Linux> ../bin/MEMPHYS_read_plot -ttf  # plot with text font done with freetype.

To run CERN-ROOT related plotting : 

     Linux> cd ..
        sh> . ./cern_root_setup.sh         # to use CERN-ROOT found under /home/euronunet/soft/root_genie-6.08.00
     Linux> cd exa_run
     Linux> ../bin/MEMPHYS_read_plot_ROOT
